description: Lists all FHIR data stores that are in the user's account, regardless of data store status.

parameters.name: Filter
parameters.description: Lists all filters associated with a FHIR data store request. DatastoreName (string) --- Allows the user to filter data store results by name. DatastoreStatus (string) --- Allows the user to filter data store results by status. CreatedBefore (datetime) --- A filter that allows the user to set cutoff dates for records. All data stores created before the specified date will be included in the results. CreatedAfter (datetime) --- A filter that allows the user to set cutoff dates for records. All data stores created after the specified date will be included in the results.

nested_params.name: DatastoreName
nested_params.description: Allows the user to filter data store results by name.

nested_params.name: DatastoreStatus
nested_params.description: Allows the user to filter data store results by status.

nested_params.name: CreatedBefore
nested_params.description: A filter that allows the user to set cutoff dates for records. All data stores created before the specified date will be included in the results.

nested_params.name: CreatedAfter
nested_params.description: A filter that allows the user to set cutoff dates for records. All data stores created after the specified date will be included in the results.

nested_items.name: DatastorePropertiesList
nested_items.description: All properties associated with the listed data stores.

nested_items.name: DatastoreId
nested_items.description: The AWS-generated ID number for the data store.

nested_items.name: DatastoreArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name used in the creation of the data store.

nested_items.name: DatastoreName
nested_items.description: The user-generated name for the data store.

nested_items.name: DatastoreStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the data store.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The time that a data store was created.

nested_items.name: DatastoreTypeVersion
nested_items.description: The FHIR version. Only R4 version data is supported.

nested_items.name: DatastoreEndpoint
nested_items.description: The AWS endpoint for the data store. Each data store will have it's own endpoint with data store ID in the endpoint URL.

nested_items.name: SseConfiguration
nested_items.description: The server-side encryption key configuration for a customer provided encryption key (CMK).

nested_items.name: KmsEncryptionConfig
nested_items.description: The KMS encryption configuration used to provide details for data encryption.

nested_items.name: CmkType
nested_items.description: The type of customer-managed-key(CMK) used for encryption. The two types of supported CMKs are customer owned CMKs and AWS owned CMKs.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The KMS encryption key id/alias used to encrypt the data store contents at rest.

nested_items.name: PreloadDataConfig
nested_items.description: The preloaded data configuration for the data store. Only data preloaded from Synthea is supported.

nested_items.name: PreloadDataType
nested_items.description: The type of preloaded data. Only Synthea preloaded data is supported.

nested_items.name: IdentityProviderConfiguration
nested_items.description: The identity provider that you selected when you created the data store.

nested_items.name: AuthorizationStrategy
nested_items.description: The authorization strategy that you selected when you created the data store.

nested_items.name: FineGrainedAuthorizationEnabled
nested_items.description: If you enabled fine-grained authorization when you created the data store.

nested_items.name: Metadata
nested_items.description: The JSON metadata elements that you want to use in your identity provider configuration. Required elements are listed based on the launch specification of the SMART application. For more information on all possible elements, see Metadata in SMART's App Launch specification.

nested_items.name: IdpLambdaArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function that you want to use to decode the access token created by the authorization server.

nested_items.name: ErrorCause
nested_items.description: The error cause for the current data store operation.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: The text of the error message.

nested_items.name: ErrorCategory
nested_items.description: The error category of the create/delete data store operation. Possible statuses are RETRYABLE_ERROR or NON_RETRYABLE_ERROR.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: Pagination token that can be used to retrieve the next page of results.
